clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase III Study of Abatacept (BMS-188667) in Patients With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis and Inadequate Response to Methotrexate
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multi-Center, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study and Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Abatacept in Combination Therapy With Methotrexate Versus Methotrexate Alone in Subjects With Active Rheumatoid Arthritis and Inadequate Response to Methotrexate

brief_summary.textblock:
Short Term: The purpose of this clinical research study is to learn if abatacept (BMS-188667) in combination with methotrexate is better than methotrexate alone in participants that have active rheumatoid arthritis and are not responding to methotrexate. The safety of this treatment will also be studied.
Long Term Extension: The purpose of this amendment is to provide participants who have completed the initial 12-month double-blind treatment period the opportunity to receive open label treatment with active drug treatment until abatacept is approved in the local country or until clinical development has been discontinued.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of American College of Rheumatology 20 (ACR 20) Responders at Day 169
primary_outcome.description: ACR 20 response requires a patient to have a 20% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 20% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) score. A participant achieved a sustained ACR 20 response if the participant had ACR 20 observed for at least 2 consecutive study visits.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving Clinically Meaningful Improvement in Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) at Day 365
primary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI includes 20 questions to assess physical function in 8 domains: dressing, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and common activities. The domain questions are evaluated on a 4-point scale: 0=without any difficulty, 1=with some difficulty, 2=with much difficulty, 3=unable to do. HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.

primary_outcome.measure: Baseline and Mean Change From Baseline (BL) in Radiographic Erosion Score Results at Day 365
primary_outcome.description: To assess joint damage progression, the Genant-modified Sharp scoring method was used to evaluate radiographs of hands/wrists and feet for erosions. The erosion score range is 0 (no radiographic damage) to 145 (worst possible radiographic damage). Change from baseline = Post-baseline - Baseline value

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With Deaths, Adverse Events (AEs) and SAEs in the Open-Label (OL) Period
primary_outcome.description: AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With Hematology Values Meeting the Marked Abnormality Criteria in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Marked abnormality criteria are: Hemoglobin (HGB): >3 g/dL decrease from BL; Hematocrit: <0.75 * BL; Erythrocytes: <0.75 * BL; Platelets (PLT): <0.67 * LLN/>1.5 * ULN, or if BL < LLN then use <0.5 * BL and <100,000 mm^3; Leukocytes: <0.75 * LLN/ >1.25 * ULN, or if BL<LLN then use <0.8 * BL or >ULN, or if BL>ULN then use >1.2 * BL or <LLN; neutrophils+bands: <1.0 * 10^3 c/uL; eosinophils: >0.750 * 10^3 c/uL; basophils: > 400 mm^3; monocytes: >2000 mm^3; lymphocytes: <0.750 * 10^3 c/uL/ >7.50 * 10^3 c/uL.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With Liver and Kidney Function Values Meeting the Marked Abnormality Criteria in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Marked abnormality criteria are: Hemoglobin (HGB): >3 g/dL decrease from BL; Hematocrit: <0.75 * BL; Erythrocytes: <0.75 * BL; Platelets (PLT): <0.67 * LLN/>1.5 * ULN, or if BL < LLN then use <0.5 * BL and <100,000 mm^3; Leukocytes: <0.75 * LLN/ >1.25 * ULN, or if BL<LLN then use <0.8 * BL or >ULN, or if BL>ULN then use >1.2 * BL or <LLN; neutrophils+bands: <1.0 * 10^3 c/uL; eosinophils: >0.750 * 10^3 c/uL; basophils: > 400 mm^3; monocytes: >2000 mm^3; lymphocytes: <0.750 * 10^3 c/uL/ >7.50 * 10^3 c/uL.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With Electrolyte Values Meeting the Marked Abnormality Criteria in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Sodium < 0.9 * LLN or > 1.05 * ULN or if BL < LLN then use < 0.95 * BL or > ULN or if BL > ULN then use >1.05 *BL or < LLN; Potassium: < 0.9 * LLN or > 1.1 * ULN or if BL < LLN then use < 0.9 * BL or > ULN or if BL > ULN then use 1.1 * BL or < LLN; Chloride: < 0.9 * LLN or > 1.1 * ULN or if BL < LLN then use <0.9 * BL or >ULN or if BL > ULN then use > 1.1 * BL or < LLN; Calcium <0.8 * LLN or > 1.2 * ULN or if BL < LLN then use <0.67 * BL or > ULN or if BL > ULN then use > 1.3 * BL or < LLN.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With Glucose, Protein, Metabolites, and Urinalysis Values Meeting the Marked Abnormality Criteria in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Glucose: < 65 mg/dL or > 220 mg/dL; Fasting Glucose: <0.8 * LLN or > 1.5 * ULN or if BL < LLN then use < 0.8 * BL or > ULN or if BL > ULN then use 1.1 * BL or < LLN; Total protein: < 0.9 * LLN or 1.1 * ULN or if BL < LLN then use 0.9 * BL or > ULN or if BL > ULN then use 1.1 * BL or < LLN; Albumin: < 0.9 * LLN or if BL < LLN then use 0.75 * BL; Uric acid: > 1.5 * ULN or if BL > ULN then use > 2.0 * BL. All urinalysis abnormalities were defined as: if missing BL then use >= 2 or if value >=4, or if BL = 0 or 0.5 then use >= 2, or if BL = 1.0 then use >= 3, or if BL = 2.0 then use >=4.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Immunoglobulins Over Time in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are those that are reported for each cohort at each time point on Day 365, Day 729, and Day 1,093.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Immunoglobulins in the OL Period
Participants With Immunogenicity to Abatacept in the Cumulative DB + OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Participants with titers to abatacept in the DB and OL periods. Serum samples from abatacept-treated adult participants with active Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) were screened for the presence of drug-specific antibodies using two validated direct-format enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays (ELISAs) to determine the presence of antibodies to abatacept and or CTLA4-T.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs in the OL Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 365 to Day 1,821. All changes in participant vital signs were monitored on each day of study drug administration prior to dosing and 60 minutes after dosing.
primary_outcome.description: Vital signs included body temperature, heart rate, and seated blood pressure. Clinically significant changes were defined as those that were not within the normal range for the participant.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing AEs of Special Interest in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: AEs were defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre- existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. AEs of special interest have been identified to be those which may be associated with the use of immunomodulatory agents or infusion of therapeutic proteins. Acute infusional AEs were defined as those that occurred within 1 hour after the start of the infusion.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Hematocrit in the OL Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (Day 0), Day 365, Day 729, Day 1,093, Day 1,457, Day 1,821, Day 1,905, Day 1,989, Day 2,073, Day 2,185
primary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are those that are reported for each cohort at each time point on Day 365 to Day 2,185.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Participant Hematocrit in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: All changes in participant laboratory parameters were monitored on each day of study drug administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Platelet Count in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are those that are reported for each cohort at each time point on Day 365 to Day 2,185.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Participant Platelet Count in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: All changes in participant laboratory parameters were monitored on each day of study drug administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Hemoglobin, Total Protein, and Albumin in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are those that are reported for each cohort at each time point on Day 365 to Day 2,185.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Hemoglobin, Total Protein, and Albumin in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: All changes in participant laboratory parameters were monitored on each day of study drug administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean BL White Blood Cells in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are those that are reported for each cohort at each time point on Day 365 to Day 2,185.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in White Blood Cells in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: All changes in participant laboratory parameters were monitored on each day of study drug administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Liver Function Parameters in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are those that are reported for each cohort at each time point on Day 365 to Day 2,185.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Liver Function Parameters in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: All changes in participant laboratory parameters were monitored on each day of study drug administration.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Select Laboratory Parameters in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are those that are reported for each cohort at each time point on Day 365 to Day 2,185.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Select Laboratory Parameters in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: All changes in participant laboratory parameters were monitored on each day of study drug administration.

primary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are those that are reported for each cohort at each time point on Day 365 to Day 2,185.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Serum Electrolytes in the OL Period
primary_outcome.description: All changes in participant laboratory parameters were monitored on each day of study drug administration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Number of Tender Joints and Swollen Joints at DB BL
Mean DB BL Participant Physical Pain Assessment, Participant Global Assessment, and Physician Global Assessment
secondary_outcome.description: Participant physical pain assessment was determined at baseline on the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) of 0 mm to 100 mm where 0mm is no pain and 100mm is worst pain possible. The mean participant global assessment is a measure of overall disease burden and is a component of the ACR and evaluated using the VAS 100 mm. The physician global assessment is a measure of overall disease burden and is a component of the ACR and evaluated using the VAS 0mm to 100 mm with 0mm indicating no disease burden and 100mm indicating worse disease burden possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: BL Rheumatoid Factor (RF) Status for Participants Continuing in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: This analysis determined whether participants in the OL period were RF positive or RF negative based on serum samples. A positive value for RF was > 20 IU/ml; a negative value for RF was ≤ 20 IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR 20 Responders at Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 20 response requires a patient to have a 20% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 20% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score. A participant achieved a sustained ACR 20 response if the participant had ACR 20 observed for at least 2 consecutive study visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR 20 Responders in the Double-Blind (DB) Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 20 response requires a patient to have a 20% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 20% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR 50 Responders at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 50 response requires a patient to have a 50% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 50% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score. A participant achieved a sustained ACR 50 response if the participant had ACR 50 observed for at least 2 consecutive study visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR 50 Responders at Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 50 response requires a patient to have a 50% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 50% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR 50 Responders in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 50 response requires a patient to have a 50% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 50% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score. A participant achieved a sustained ACR 50 response if the participant had ACR 50 observed for at least 2 consecutive study visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR 70 Responders at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 70 response requires a patient to have a 70% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 70% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR 70 Responders at Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 70 response requires a patient to have a 70% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 70% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR 70 Responders in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 70 response requires a patient to have a 70% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 70% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving Major Clinical Response By Day 365
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 365. Data were collected monthly during the first 6 months and then every other month (with the exception of Day 337) during the second 6 months of the DB period.
secondary_outcome.description: A Major Clinical Response (MCR) is defined as maintenance of an ACR 70 response over a continuous 6-month period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL and Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS-28; Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate [ESR]) at Day 169 and Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS 28 is an assessment of disease activity measured on a visual analog scale (VAS)of 100 mm. The scale reports from 1 to 10, with increasing number indicating increasing extent of disease progression. Scores for disease activity are defined as high (>5.1); low (≤3.2); remission (<2.6). Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Death, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Related SAEs, Discontinuation Due to SAEs, AEs, Related AEs, or Discontinued Due to AEs in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean DB BL and Mean Change From BL in Joint Space Narrowing (JSN) and Total Score (TS)
secondary_outcome.description: To assess joint damage progression, the Genant-modified Sharp scoring method was used to evaluate radiographs of hands/wrists and feet for erosions and joint space narrowing (JSN). The total Genant-modified Sharp score ranges from 0 (no radiographic damage) to 290 (worst possible radiographic damage) and is the sum of the erosion score (range 0-145) and the joint space narrowing score (range 0-145). Higher scores indicated more damage. Change from baseline = Post-baseline - Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean DB BL Physical Component Summary of Health-Related Quality of Life (SF-36)
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 covers 8 health dimensions including 4 physical subscales (physical function, role-physical, bodily pain, and general health) and 4 mental subscales (vitality, social function, role-emotional, and mental health). The scores range from a minimum of 0 to a maximum of 100, with a higher score indicating better quality of life. Improvements of > 3 points were considered clinically meaningful. Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From BL in the Physical Component Summary of Health-Related Quality of Life (SF-36) in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 covers 8 health dimensions including 4 physical subscales (physical function, role-physical, bodily pain, and general health) and 4 mental subscales (vitality, social function, role-emotional, and mental health). All subscales were scored using norm-based methods that standardized the scores to a mean of 50 and a standard deviation of 10 in the general population. The scores range from a minimum of 0 to a maximum of 100, with a higher score indicating better quality of life. Improvements of > 3 points were considered clinically meaningful.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants in the DB Period Achieving an Extended Major Clinical Response
secondary_outcome.description: An extended major clinical response (MCR) was defined as a continuous ACR 70 response over any nine month treatment period with study medications. ACR 70 response criteria requires a patient to have a 70% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 70% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL DAS-28 C-Reactive Protein (CRP) and ESR in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: The mean baseline CRP and ESR in the DB period on Day 169 and Day 365 was evaluated for all treated participants. Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From BL in DAS-28 CRP and ESR in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in CRP and ESR in the DB period was evaluated for all treated participants. Adjustment based on ANCOVA model with treatment as factor and baseline value as covariate.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Soluble Interleukin-2 Receptors (sIL2-r) in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: The mean baseline sIL2-r in the DB period was evaluated from serum samples for all treated participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Soluble Interleukin-2 Receptors (sIL2-r) in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in sIL2-r in the DB period was evaluated for all treated participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR Core Component: Mean Number of Tender Joints at All Post-BL Visits in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR Core Component: Mean Number of Swollen Joints at All Post-BL Visits in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: The mean number of swollen joints in the DB period was evaluated based on the swollen joint core component of the ACR scoring system where increasing score indicates increasing level of severity. Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR Core Component: Mean Participant Pain Assessment at All Post-BL Visits in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: Participant self-reported pain assessment core component of the ACR scoring system where increasing score indicates increasing level of severity as indicated on a 100mm Visual Analog Scale (VAS) with 0mm representing no pain and 100mm representing the most pain possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR Core Component: Mean Participant Physical Function Assessment at All Post-BL Visits in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI includes 20 questions to assess physical function in 8 domains: dressing, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and common activities. The domain questions are evaluated on a 4-point scale: 0=without any difficulty, 1=with some difficulty, 2=with much difficulty, 3=unable to do. HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR Core Component: Mean Participant Global Assessment at All Post-BL Visits in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: Participant self-reported global RA assessment core component of the ACR scoring system where increasing score indicates increasing level of severity as indicated on a 100mm Visual Analog Scale (VAS) with 0mm representing no pain and 100mm representing the most pain possible.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR Core Component: Mean Physician Global Assessment at All Post-BL Visits in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: Physician global RA assessment core component of the ACR scoring system where increasing score indicates increasing level of severity as indicated on a 100mm Visual Analog Scale (VAS) with 0mm representing very good global RA assessment and 100mm representing very poor global RA assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: ACR Core Component: Mean CRP at All Post-BL Visits in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: CRP core component of the ACR scoring system was evaluated from serum samples in which increasing levels indicate increasing level of disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Discontinuing in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 169, Day 170 to Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: Participants that discontinued treatment during the DB period for any reason were evaluated after 6 months and 1 year of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From BL in Joint Narrowing Score (JSN), Erosion Score (ES), and Total Score (TS) by Category in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: To assess joint damage progression, the Genant-modified Sharp scoring method was used to evaluate radiographs of hands/wrists and feet for erosions and joint space narrowing (JSN). The total Genant-modified Sharp score ranges from 0 (no radiographic damage) to 290 (worst possible radiographic damage) and is the sum of the erosion score (range 0-145) and the joint space narrowing score (range 0-145). Higher scores indicated more damage. Improvement=decreases from BL, stable=same as BL, worsening=increases from BL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants Experiencing Clinically Significant Changes in Vital Signs in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: All changes in participant vital signs were monitored on each day of study drug administration prior to dosing and 60 minutes after dosing. Vital signs included body temperature, heart rate, and seated blood pressure. Clinical significance was defined as any change from baseline that resulted in a value outside the normal limits for the participant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants Experiencing AEs of Special Interest in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: AEs were defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre- existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. AEs were identified as those which may be associated with the use of immunomodulatory agents or infusion of therapeutic proteins. Acute infusional AEs were defined as those that occurred within 1 hour after the start of the infusion.

secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI includes 20 questions to assess physical function in 8 domains: dressing, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and common activities. The domain questions are evaluated on a 4-point scale: 0=without any difficulty, 1=with some difficulty, 2=with much difficulty, 3=unable to do. HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From BL in Individual Components of the HAQ DI at Day 169
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI includes 20 questions to assess physical function in 8 domains: dressing, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and common activities. The domain questions are evaluated on a 4-point scale: 0=without any difficulty, 1=with some difficulty, 2=with much difficulty, 3=unable to do. HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Mean Change From BL in Individual Components of the HAQ DI at Day 365
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI includes 20 questions to assess physical function in 8 domains: dressing, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and common activities. The domain questions are evaluated on a 4-point scale: 0=without any difficulty, 1=with some difficulty, 2=with much difficulty, 3=unable to do. HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Immunogenicity to Abatacept in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: Participants with titers to abatacept in the DB period. Serum samples from abatacept-treated adult participants with active RA were screened for the presence of drug-specific antibodies using two validated direct-format enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays (ELISAs) to determine the presence of antibodies to abatacept and/or CTLA4-T.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of New Tender Joints and Number of New Swollen Joints in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: Tender joints and swollen joints are core components of the ACR 20, 50, and 70. The incidences of new tender joints and new swollen joints were evaluated in the DB period after 6 months and 1 year of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing a 100% Reduction in Tender Joints or 100% Reduction in Swollen Joints in the DB Period
Number of Participants With Hematology Laboratories Meeting Marked Abnormality Criteria in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: Marked abnormality criteria were: Hemoglobin (HGB): >3 g/dL decrease from BL; Hematocrit: <0.75 * BL; Erythrocytes: <0.75 * BL; Platelets (PLT): <0.67 * LLN/>1.5 * ULN, or if BL < LLN then use <0.5 * BL and <100,000 mm^3; Leukocytes: <0.75 * LLN/ >1.25 * ULN, or if BL<LLN then use <0.8 * BL or >ULN, or if BL>ULN then use >1.2 * BL or <LLN; neutrophils+bands: <1.0 * 10^3 c/uL; eosinophils: >0.750 * 10^3 c/uL; basophils: > 400 mm^3; monocytes: >2000 mm^3; lymphocytes: <0.750 * 10^3 c/uL/ >7.50 * 10^3 c/uL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Liver and Kidney Function Tests Meeting Marked Abnormality Criteria in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: Marked abnormality criteria were: Aspartate Aminotransferase (AST) >3 * ULN or if BL > ULN then use >4 *BL; Alanine Aminotransferase (ALT) >3 * ULN or if BL > ULN then use > 4 * BL; Creatinine > 1.5 * BL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL ESR and CRP Levels in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are reported for each cohort at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in ESR in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: Serum samples were evaluated from study participants to determine the mean change from baseline in ESR values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participant RF Seroconversion in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: This analysis determined participant RF status (positive or RF negative) based on serum samples at each specified timepoint. A positive value for RF was > 20 IU/ml; a negative value for RF was ≤ 20 IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of ACR 20 Responders in the DB and OL Periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365, Day 449, Day 533, Day 617, Day 729, Day 813, Day 897, Day 981, Day 1,083, Day 1,177, Day 1,261, Day 1,345, Day 1,497, Day 1,625, Day 1,821
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 20 response requires a patient to have a 20% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 20% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, CRP or ESR, and degree of disability in HAQ score. A participant achieved a sustained ACR 20 response if the participant had ACR 20 observed for at least 2 consecutive study visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of ACR 50 Responders in the DB and OL Periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365, Day 449, Day 533, Day 617, Day 729, Day 813, Day 897, Day 981, Day 1,083, Day 1,177, Day 1,261, Day 1,345, Day 1,497, Day 1,625, Day 1,821
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 50 response requires a patient to have a 50% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 50% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, CRP or ESR, and degree of disability in HAQ score.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of ACR 70 Responders in the DB and OL Periods
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365, Day 449, Day 533, Day 617, Day 729, Day 813, Day 897, Day 981, Day 1,083, Day 1,177, Day 1,261, Day 1,345, Day 1,497, Day 1,625, Day 1,821
secondary_outcome.description: ACR 70 response requires a patient to have a 70% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 70% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, CRP or ESR, and degree of disability in HAQ score. A participant achieved a sustained ACR 70 response if the participant had ACR 70 observed for at least 2 consecutive study visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Continuing in the OL Period With DAS-28 Remission or Low DAS-28 Activity Over Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365, Day 449, Day 533, Day 617, Day 729, Day 813, Day 897, Day 981, Day 1,083, Day 1,177, Day 1,261, Day 1,345, Day 1,497, Day 1,625, Day 1,821, Day 1,989, Day 2,185
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS 28 is a continuous measure evaluating extent of disease activity in RA, and is a composite of 4 variables: the 28 tender joint count, the 28 swollen joint count, erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) and participant assessment of disease activity measure on a visual analog scale (VAS) of 100 mm. The scale reports from 1 to 10, with increasing number indicating increasing extent of disease progression. Scores for disease activity are defined as high (> 5.1); low (≤ 3.2); remission (< 2.6).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL DAS-28 CRP Over Time for Participants Continuing in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: BL(Day 0), Day 15, Day 29,Day 57,Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365, Day 449, Day 533, Day 617, Day 729, Day 813, Day 897, Day 981, Day 1,083, Day 1,177, Day 1,261, Day 1,345, Day 1,497, Day 1,625, Day 1,821, Day 1,989, Day 2,185
secondary_outcome.description: Time-matched BL (Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in DAS-28 CRP Over Time for Participants Continuing in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: BL(Day 0),Day 15,Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365, Day 449, Day 533, Day 617, Day 729, Day 813, Day 897, Day 981, Day 1,083, Day 1,177, Day 1,261, Day 1,345, Day 1,497, Day 1,625, Day 1,821, Day 1,989, Day 2,185
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in participant were calculated at all study visits in the DB and OL periods.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL DAS-28 ESR Over Time in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are reported for each cohort at each time point. Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in DAS-28 ESR Over Time in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in participant serum values of ESR were calculated at all study visits in the OL period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving HAQ Response Over Time for Participants Continuing in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365, Day 449, Day 533, Day 617, Day 729, Day 813, Day 897, Day 981, Day 1,083, Day 1,177, Day 1,261, Day 1,345, Day 1,497, Day 1,625, Day 1,821
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI includes 20 questions to assess physical function in 8 domains: dressing, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and common activities. The domain questions are evaluated on a 4-point scale: 0=without any difficulty, 1=with some difficulty, 2=with much difficulty, 3=unable to do. HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.

secondary_outcome.measure: BL and Mean Change From BL in Radiographic Erosion, Joint Space Narrowing (JSN), and Total Scores (TS) in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: BL (Day 0), Day 365, Day 729, Day 1,093, Day 1,457, Day 1,821
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the Genant-modified Sharp erosion score, JSN, TS were evaluated for all participants at the end of the OL period. The total Genant-modified Sharp score (TS) ranges from 0 (no radiographic damage) to 290 (worst possible radiographic damage) and is the sum of the erosion score (range 0-145) and the joint space narrowing score (range 0-145).Higher scores indicated more damage. Time-matched BL (Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Physical Component Summary of the SF-36 by Visit in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 covers 8 health dimensions including 4 physical subscales (physical function, role-physical, bodily pain, and general health) and 4 mental subscales (vitality, social function, role-emotional, and mental health). The scores range from a minimum of 0 to a maximum of 100, with a higher score indicating better quality of life. Improvements of > 3 points were considered clinically meaningful. Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL by Visit in the Physical Component Summary of the SF-36 in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 covers 8 health dimensions including 4 physical subscales (physical function, role-physical, bodily pain, and general health) and 4 mental subscales (vitality, social function, role-emotional, and mental health). All subscales were scored using norm-based methods that standardized the scores to a mean of 50 and a standard deviation of 10 in the general population. The scores range from a minimum of 0 to a maximum of 100, with a higher score indicating better quality of life. Improvements of > 3 points were considered clinically meaningful.

secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 covers 8 health dimensions including 4 physical subscales (physical function, role-physical, bodily pain, and general health) and 4 mental subscales (vitality, social function, role-emotional, and mental health). The scores range from a minimum of 0 to a maximum of 100, with a higher score indicating better quality of life. secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Fatigue in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are reported for each cohort at each time point using the VAS 100 mm where 0= no fatigue to 100 = the worst fatigue imaginable. Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Fatigue in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in fatigue was measured on the VAS 100 mm where 0= no fatigue to 100 = the worst fatigue imaginable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Sleep Quality in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are reported for each cohort at each time point using the Medical Outcomes Study Sleep scale (MOS-sleep [assesses the extent of sleep problems and measures six dimensions of sleep on a 12-item participant-reported measure]). An overall Sleep Problems Index (SPI) was generated as a summary measure of different types of sleep problems (sleep disturbance, sleep quantity, sleep adequacy, etc.). The score ranges from 0 to 100, with 0 = no problems with sleep and 100 = the most severe problems with sleep. The mean score of the SPI in a population with chronic conditions is 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Sleep Quality in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in sleep quality was assessed on the Medical Outcomes Study Sleep scale (MOS-sleep [assesses the extent of sleep problems and measures six dimensions of sleep on a 12-item participant-reported measure]). An overall Sleep Problems Index (SPI) was generated as a summary measure of different types of sleep problems (sleep disturbance, sleep quantity, sleep adequacy, etc.). The score ranges from 0 to 100, with 0 = no problems with sleep and 100 = the most severe problems with sleep. The mean score of the SPI in a population with chronic conditions is 29.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Limitations on Activities of Daily Living in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: BL (Day 0), Day 365, Day 449, Day 533, Day 729, Day 813, Day 897, Day 981, Day 1,093, Day 1,177, Day 1,261, Day 1,345, Day 1,457
secondary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are reported for each cohort at each time point. Activity limitation was measured by the number of days in the past 30 days a participant was unable to perform usual activities due to RA. Time-matched BL (Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Limitations on Activities of Daily Living in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: BL (Day 0), Day 365, Day 449, Day 533, Day 729, Day 813, Day 897, Day 981, Day 1,093, Day 1,177, Day 1,261, Day 1,345, Day 1,457
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in limitations on activities of daily living in the OL period. Activity limitation was measured by the number of days in the past 30 days a participant was unable to perform usual activities due to RA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL Interleukin-6 (IL-6), SIL-2R, and Tumor Necrosis Alpha (TNF-Alpha) in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are reported for each cohort at each time point. Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in Interleukin-6 (IL-6), SIL-2R, and Tumor Necrosis Alpha (TNF-Alpha) in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in potential biomarkers of disease (IL-6, SIL-3R, and TNF-Alpha were determined for all participants.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in RF in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from baseline in participant rheumatoid factor was determined after 6 months and 1 year of treatment relative to baseline. Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL E-Selectin, SICAM-1, and MMP3 in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: Mean baseline values are reported for each cohort at each time point. Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From BL in E-Selectin, SICAM-1, and MMP3 in the DB Period
secondary_outcome.description: The mean change from basline in particpant biomarkers of RA disease (E-Selectin, SICAM-1, and MMP3) after 6 months and 1 year of treatment, relative to baseline, were evaluated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean BL HAQ-DI Score and HAQ-DI Individual Component Scores at BL (Day 0) for the Day 365 Cohort of Participants Continuing in the OL Period
secondary_outcome.description: The HAQ-DI includes 20 questions to assess physical function in 8 domains: dressing, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and common activities. The domain questions are evaluated on a 4-point scale: 0=without any difficulty, 1=with some difficulty, 2=with much difficulty, 3=unable to do. HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.

HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.

arm_group.description: Short Term: Abatacept was dosed by weight with participants weighing < 60 kg received abatacept 500 mg; participants ≥ 60 kg and ≤ 100 kg received abatacept 750 mg; and participants > 100 kg received abatacept 1 g. Participants continued treatment with methotrexate (MTX) either orally or parenterally at a minimum dose of 15 mg.
Short Term: Participants received a placebo solution intravenously and methotrexate at the dose employed prior to study enrollment and a minimum of 15 mg.

Open Label: Abatacept was dosed intravenously by weight at 10 mg/kg in the OL period under tiered dosing such that participants weighing < 60 kg received abatacept 500 mg; participants ≥ 60 kg and ≤ 100 kg received abatacept 750 mg; and participants > 100 kg received abatacept 1 g. MTX was continued at the dose used in the DB period.

intervention.description: Intravenous (IV) Solution, - Weight Titered (500 mg < 60 kg); (750 mg 60-100 kg), )1 gram > 100 kg), Day 1, Day 15, Day 29; every 28 days thereafter, 1 year
IV solution, Intravenous, D5W, Day 1, Day 15, Day 29; every 28 days thereafter, 1 year

criteria.textblock:
- Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) for greater than 1 year from the time of initial diagnosis of RA.
- Participants must have been taking methotrexate for at least 3 months with at least a weekly dose of 15 mg.

link.description: For FDA Safety Alerts and Recalls refer to the following link www.fda.gov/MEDWATCH/safety.htm

results_reference.citation: Kremer JM, Genant HK, Moreland LW, Russell AS, Emery P, Abud-Mendoza C, Szechinski J, Li T, Ge Z, Becker JC, Westhovens R. Effects of abatacept in patients with methotrexate-resistant active rheumatoid arthritis: a randomized trial. Ann Intern Med. 2006 Jun 20;144(12):865-76.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants in this evaluation were enrolled 116 sites worldwide: 31 sites in the United States; 32 sites in Europe, 13 sites in Canada; 4 sites in Australia; 7 sites in Argentina; 7 sites in Brazil; 7 sites in Mexico; 3 sites in Peru; 5 sites in South Africa; 3 sites in Taiwan; and 4 sites in Turkey.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Of 1250 participants enrolled, 594 participants were not randomized (519 no longer met study criteria, 37 for unknown reasons, 33 withdrew consent, 3 lost to follow-up, 1 administrative reason by sponsor, and 1 adverse event). Four participants (2 per group) were randomized but never treated; 2 no longer met study criteria and 2 withdrew consent.

group.title: Abatacept (ABA) + Methotrexate (MTX) DB
group.description: Abatacept was dosed intravenously by weight with participants weighing < 60 kg received 500 mg, participants weighing 60 kg to 100 kg received 750 mg, and participants weighing > 100 kg received 1 gram. Study medication was administered on Days 1, 15, 29, and every 28 days thereafter for a total of 14 doses. Each dose was infused intravenously over approximately 30 minutes on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337. Participants also received MTX at a minimum dose of (10-30 mg/wk), although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity.

group.title: MTX + Placebo DB
group.description: Control group receiving MTX treatment in combination with placebo. Participants received MTX at a minimum dose of (10-30 mg/wk), although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity. Placebo was administered IV on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337.

group.title: ABA + MTX [Open-label (OL)]
group.description: Abatacept was dosed intravenously by weight at 10 mg/kg in the OL period under tiered dosing such that participants weighing < 60 kg received abatacept 500 mg; participants ≥ 60 kg and ≤ 100 kg received abatacept 750 mg; and participants > 100 kg received abatacept 1 g. MTX was continued at the dose used in the DB period.

group.title: ABA + MTX DB
group.description: Abatacept was dosed by weight with participants weighing < 60 kg received 500 mg, participants weighing 60 kg to 100 kg received 750 mg, and participants weighing > 100 kg received 1 gram. Study medication was administered on Days 1, 15, 29, and every 28 days thereafter for a total of 14 doses. Each dose was infused intravenously over approximately 30 minutes on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337. Participants also received MTX at a minimum dose of (10-30 mg/wk), although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity. Placebo and MTX were administered IV on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337.

group.title: MTX + Placebo DB
group.description: Control group receiving MTX treatment in combination with placebo. Participants received MTX at a minimum dose of (10-30 mg/wk), although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity. Placebo was administered IV on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race (NIH/OMB)

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Duration of Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) Disease
measure.description: Number of participants with RA duration <= 2 years, > 2 years to <= 5 years, > 5 years to <= 10 years, and > 10 years as evaluated at baseline.

outcome.title: Number of American College of Rheumatology 20 (ACR 20) Responders at Day 169
outcome.description: ACR 20 response requires a patient to have a 20% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 20% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) score. A participant achieved a sustained ACR 20 response if the participant had ACR 20 observed for at least 2 consecutive study visits.
outcome.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis.

group.title: ABA + MTX DB
group.description: Abatacept was dosed intravenously by weight with participants weighing < 60 kg received 500 mg, participants weighing 60 kg to 100 kg received 750 mg, and participants weighing > 100 kg received 1 gram. Study medication was administered on Days 1, 15, 29, and every 28 days thereafter for a total of 14 doses. Each dose was infused intravenously over approximately 30 minutes on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337. Participants also received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity.

group.description: Control group receiving MTX treatment in combination with placebo. Participants received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity. Placebo and MTX were administered IV on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337.

measure.title: Number of American College of Rheumatology 20 (ACR 20) Responders at Day 169
measure.description: ACR 20 response requires a patient to have a 20% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 20% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) score. A participant achieved a sustained ACR 20 response if the participant had ACR 20 observed for at least 2 consecutive study visits.
measure.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis.

analysis.groups_desc: The study had a 99% power to detect a difference of 20% in ACR 20 between the 2 groups at the 5% level.
analysis.estimate_desc: Estimated difference between ABA + MTX and MTX + PLA is the estimated difference between ABA+MTX and MTX + PLA in the proportion of participants achieving ACR 20 response.

measure.description: The HAQ-DI includes 20 questions to assess physical function in 8 domains: dressing, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and common activities. The domain questions are evaluated on a 4-point scale: 0=without any difficulty, 1=with some difficulty, 2=with much difficulty, 3=unable to do. HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.
measure.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis.

analysis.p_value_desc: Based on the hierarchical testing procedure for the co-primary measures, the study had 98% power to detect 18% difference in HAQ response rate between the two arms at the 5% level.
analysis.method_desc: This model includes treatment as the main factor and baseline value as a covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: Estimated difference between ABA + MTX and MTX + PLA is the estimated difference between ABA+MTX and MTX + PLA in the proportion of participants achieving HAQ response at Day 365.

outcome.title: Baseline and Mean Change From Baseline (BL) in Radiographic Erosion Score Results at Day 365
outcome.description: To assess joint damage progression, the Genant-modified Sharp scoring method was used to evaluate radiographs of hands/wrists and feet for erosions. The erosion score range is 0 (no radiographic damage) to 145 (worst possible radiographic damage). Change from baseline = Post-baseline - Baseline value
outcome.population: All randomized and treated participants in the DB period with radiographic data available at baseline and Day 365. Due to the compliance issues of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis.

group.title: ABA + MTX DB
group.description: Abatacept was dosed intravenously by weight with participants weighing < 60 kg received 500 mg, participants weighing 60 kg to 100 kg received 750 mg, and participants weighing > 100 kg received 1 gram. Study medication was administered on Days 1, 15, 29, and every 28 days thereafter for a total of 14 doses. Each dose was infused intravenously over approximately 30 minutes on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337. Participants also received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity.

group.title: MTX + Placebo DB
group.description: Control group receiving MTX treatment in combination with placebo. Participants received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity. Placebo and MTX were administered IV on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337.

measure.title: Baseline and Mean Change From Baseline (BL) in Radiographic Erosion Score Results at Day 365
measure.description: To assess joint damage progression, the Genant-modified Sharp scoring method was used to evaluate radiographs of hands/wrists and feet for erosions. The erosion score range is 0 (no radiographic damage) to 145 (worst possible radiographic damage). Change from baseline = Post-baseline - Baseline value
measure.population: All randomized and treated participants in the DB period with radiographic data available at baseline and Day 365. Due to the compliance issues of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis.

analysis.method_desc: The rank of the change from baseline=dependent variable, treatment=the main factor, rank of baseline value as covariate.

outcome.population: All randomized and treated participants in the DB period.

measure.title: Mean Number of Tender Joints and Swollen Joints at DB BL
measure.population: All randomized and treated participants in the DB period.

outcome.title: Mean DB BL Participant Physical Pain Assessment, Participant Global Assessment, and Physician Global Assessment
outcome.description: Participant physical pain assessment was determined at baseline on the Visual Analog Scale (VAS) of 0 mm to 100 mm where 0mm is no pain and 100mm is worst pain possible. The mean participant global assessment is a measure of overall disease burden and is a component of the ACR and evaluated using the VAS 100 mm. The physician global assessment is a measure of overall disease burden and is a component of the ACR and evaluated using the VAS 0mm to 100 mm with 0mm indicating no disease burden and 100mm indicating worse disease burden possible.
outcome.population: All randomized and treated participants in the DB period.

outcome.title: BL Rheumatoid Factor (RF) Status for Participants Continuing in the OL Period
outcome.description: This analysis determined whether participants in the OL period were RF positive or RF negative based on serum samples. A positive value for RF was > 20 IU/ml; a negative value for RF was ≤ 20 IU/mL.
outcome.population: All treated participants in the OL period (treatment groups represent treatment received in the DB period).

group.title: ABA + MTX DB
group.description: Abatacept was dosed intravenously by weight at 10 mg/kg in the OL period under tiered dosing such that participants weighing < 60 kg received abatacept 500 mg; participants ≥ 60 kg and ≤ 100 kg received abatacept 750 mg; and participants > 100 kg received abatacept 1 g. MTX was continued at the dose used in the DB period.

group.title: MTX + Placebo DB
group.description: Control group receiving MTX treatment in combination with placebo. Participants received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity. Placebo and MTX were administered IV on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337.

measure.population: All treated participants in the OL period (treatment groups represent treatment received in the DB period).

outcome.title: ACR 20 Responders at Day 365
outcome.description: ACR 20 response requires a patient to have a 20% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 20% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score. A participant achieved a sustained ACR 20 response if the participant had ACR 20 observed for at least 2 consecutive study visits.
outcome.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Achieving Major Clinical Response By Day 365
outcome.description: A Major Clinical Response (MCR) is defined as maintenance of an ACR 70 response over a continuous 6-month period.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 365. Data were collected monthly during the first 6 months and then every other month (with the exception of Day 337) during the second 6 months of the DB period.
outcome.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis.

outcome.title: Mean BL and Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS-28; Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate [ESR]) at Day 169 and Day 365
outcome.description: The DAS 28 is an assessment of disease activity measured on a visual analog scale (VAS)of 100 mm. The scale reports from 1 to 10, with increasing number indicating increasing extent of disease progression. Scores for disease activity are defined as high (>5.1); low (≤3.2); remission (<2.6). Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.
outcome.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis. Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) analysis. N = participants analyzed and n = participants with measurements for that time point.

group.title: ABA + MTX DB
group.description: Abatacept was dosed intravenously by weight with participants weighing < 60 kg received 500 mg, participants weighing 60 kg to 100 kg received 750 mg, and participants weighing > 100 kg received 1 gram. Study medication was administered on Days 1, 15, 29, and every 28 days thereafter for a total of 14 doses. Each dose was infused intravenously over approximately 30 minutes on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337. Participants also received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity.

group.title: MTX + Placebo DB
group.description: Control group receiving MTX treatment in combination with placebo. Participants received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity. Placebo and MTX were administered IV on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337.

measure.title: Mean BL and Disease Activity Score 28 (DAS-28; Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate [ESR]) at Day 169 and Day 365
measure.description: The DAS 28 is an assessment of disease activity measured on a visual analog scale (VAS)of 100 mm. The scale reports from 1 to 10, with increasing number indicating increasing extent of disease progression. Scores for disease activity are defined as high (>5.1); low (≤3.2); remission (<2.6). Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.
measure.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis. Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF) analysis. N = participants analyzed and n = participants with measurements for that time point.

analysis.estimate_desc: Estimated difference between ABA + MTX and MTX + PLA on Day 169.
Estimated difference between ABA + MTX and MTX + PLA on Day 365.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Death, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Related SAEs, Discontinuation Due to SAEs, AEs, Related AEs, or Discontinued Due to AEs in the DB Period
outcome.description: AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
outcome.population: All treated subjects in the DB period.

group.title: ABA + MTX DB
group.description: Abatacept was dosed intravenously by weight with participants weighing < 60 kg received 500 mg, participants weighing 60 kg to 100 kg received 750 mg, and participants weighing > 100 kg received 1 gram. Each dose was infused intravenously over approximately 30 minutes on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337. Participants also received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Death, Serious Adverse Events (SAEs), Related SAEs, Discontinuation Due to SAEs, AEs, Related AEs, or Discontinued Due to AEs in the DB Period
measure.description: AE was defined as any new untoward medical occurrence or worsening of a pre-existing medical condition which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. SAE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence that at any dose: results in death, is life-threatening, requires inpatient hospitalization or causes prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, results in development of drug dependency or drug abuse, is an important medical event.
measure.population: All treated subjects in the DB period.

outcome.title: Mean DB BL and Mean Change From BL in Joint Space Narrowing (JSN) and Total Score (TS)
outcome.description: To assess joint damage progression, the Genant-modified Sharp scoring method was used to evaluate radiographs of hands/wrists and feet for erosions and joint space narrowing (JSN). The total Genant-modified Sharp score ranges from 0 (no radiographic damage) to 290 (worst possible radiographic damage) and is the sum of the erosion score (range 0-145) and the joint space narrowing score (range 0-145). Higher scores indicated more damage. Change from baseline = Post-baseline - Baseline value.
outcome.population: All randomized and treated participants in the DB period with radiographic data available at baseline and Day 365. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis.

Participants also received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity.

Placebo and MTX were administered IV on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337.

outcome.title: Mean DB BL Physical Component Summary of Health-Related Quality of Life (SF-36)
outcome.description: The SF-36 covers 8 health dimensions including 4 physical subscales (physical function, role-physical, bodily pain, and general health) and 4 mental subscales (vitality, social function, role-emotional, and mental health). The scores range from a minimum of 0 to a maximum of 100, with a higher score indicating better quality of life. Improvements of > 3 points were considered clinically meaningful. Time-matched BL(Day 0) values and post-BL vales were presented for each post-BL visit and represent only that cohort of participants with measurements available at that post-BL assessment.
outcome.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population.Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis. outcome.title: Adjusted Mean Change From BL in the Physical Component Summary of Health-Related Quality of Life (SF-36) in the DB Period
outcome.description: The SF-36 covers 8 health dimensions including 4 physical subscales (physical function, role-physical, bodily pain, and general health) and 4 mental subscales (vitality, social function, role-emotional, and mental health). All subscales were scored using norm-based methods that standardized the scores to a mean of 50 and a standard deviation of 10 in the general population. The scores range from a minimum of 0 to a maximum of 100, with a higher score indicating better quality of life. Improvements of > 3 points were considered clinically meaningful.
outcome.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population.Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis. outcome.title: Participants in the DB Period Achieving an Extended Major Clinical Response
outcome.description: An extended major clinical response (MCR) was defined as a continuous ACR 70 response over any nine month treatment period with study medications. ACR 70 response criteria requires a patient to have a 70% reduction in the number of swollen and tender joints, and a reduction of 70% in three of the following five parameters: physician global assessment of disease, patient global assessment of disease, patient assessment of pain, C-reactive protein or erythrocyte sedimentation rate, and degree of disability in HAQ score.
outcome.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis.

analysis.estimate_desc: Estimated difference between ABA + MTX and MTX + PLA is the estimated difference between ABA+MTX and MTX + PLA in the proportion of participants achieving extended MCR.

outcome.title: ACR Core Component: Mean Participant Physical Function Assessment at All Post-BL Visits in the DB Period
outcome.description: The HAQ-DI includes 20 questions to assess physical function in 8 domains: dressing, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and common activities. The domain questions are evaluated on a 4-point scale: 0=without any difficulty, 1=with some difficulty, 2=with much difficulty, 3=unable to do. HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.
outcome.time_frame: Day 15, Day 29, Day 57, Day 85, Day 113, Day 141, Day 169, Day 225, Day 281, Day 365
outcome.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) analysis. N = participants analyzed and n = participants with measurements for that time point.

group.title: ABA + MTX DB
group.description: Abatacept was dosed intravenously by weight with participants weighing < 60 kg received 500 mg, participants weighing 60 kg to 100 kg received 750 mg, and participants weighing > 100 kg received 1 gram. Study medication was administered on Days 1, 15, 29, and every 28 days thereafter for a total of 14 doses. Each dose was infused intravenously over approximately 30 minutes on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337. Participants also received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity.

group.title: MTX + Placebo DB
group.description: Control group receiving MTX treatment in combination with placebo. Participants received MTX at a minimum dose of 10-30 mg/wk, although doses of < 10 mg/wk were acceptable if due to toxicity. Placebo and MTX were administered IV on Days 1, 15, 29, 57, 85, 113, 141, 169, 197, 225, 253, 281, 309, and 337.

measure.title: ACR Core Component: Mean Participant Physical Function Assessment at All Post-BL Visits in the DB Period
measure.description: The HAQ-DI includes 20 questions to assess physical function in 8 domains: dressing, arising, eating, walking, hygiene, reach, grip, and common activities. The domain questions are evaluated on a 4-point scale: 0=without any difficulty, 1=with some difficulty, 2=with much difficulty, 3=unable to do. HAQ-DI=sum of worst scores in each domain dividied by the number of domains answered. HAQ-DI ranges from 0 to a maximum overall score of 3.0. Clinically meaningful HAQ response was defined as an improvement of at least 0.3 units from baseline in HAQ DI.
measure.population: Analyses of efficacy were based on the intent-to-treat population. Due to the non-compliance of a single site, 9 participants in the abatacept group and 5 in the placebo group were not included in this analysis. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) analysis. N = participants analyzed and n = participants with measurements for that time point.

outcome.title: ACR Core Component: Mean Participant Global Assessment at All Post-BL Visits in the DB Period
outcome.description: Participant self-reported global RA assessment core component of the ACR scoring system where increasing score indicates increasing level of severity as indicated on a 100mm Visual Analog Scale (VAS) with 0mm representing no pain and 100mm representing the most pain possible.

class.title: Day 1 to 169 DC Due to Lack of Efficacy

outcome.title: Change From BL in Joint Narrowing Score (JSN), Erosion Score (ES), and Total Score (TS) by Category in the DB Period
outcome.description: To assess joint damage progression, the Genant-modified Sharp scoring method was used to evaluate radiographs of hands/wrists and feet for erosions and joint space narrowing (JSN). The total Genant-modified Sharp score ranges from 0 (no radiographic damage) to 290 (worst possible radiographic damage) and is the sum of the erosion score (range 0-145) and the joint space narrowing score (range 0-145). Higher scores indicated more damage. Improvement=decreases from BL, stable=same as BL, worsening=increases from BL.
outcome.population: This analysis was not completed.
